direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve modifying the list by adding or removing elements at specific indices.
Both methods modify the list at a specific index, though 'add' inserts a new element while 'set' replaces an existing one.
Both methods involve adding elements to the list, though 'addAll' adds a collection of elements at once.
Both methods insert an element at a specific index, making them functionally similar.
Both methods modify the list, though 'clear' removes all elements while 'add' inserts a single element.
Both methods interact with the list's elements, though 'toArray' converts the list to an array while 'add' modifies the list.
Both methods interact with the list's elements, though 'iterator' provides an iterator while 'add' modifies the list.
Both methods interact with the list's elements, though 'listIterator' provides a list iterator while 'add' modifies the list.
